column4: hm. flash is not installable.. my problem is this one: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/flashplugin-nonfree/+bug/304969
that bug is still open if you read the bug report
yup. and the last comment gives hope... but it means i cant use flash on that hardy for an unknown time :(  (gnash isn't compatible to the single site i really need flash)
what do you want us to do about it ?
so there is no good workaround? (installing it manually is no good workaround) :-)
so the auto install doens't work, and you don't want to install manaully - what do you want ?
that bug gives you 3 options 1.) wait for a fix 2.) manually install 3.) enabled hardy backports -
well, it's just a bad thing, in feisty broke that package and now its hardy. you can not seriously convince less computer savvy people to convert to ubuntu if the flash plugin breaks all the time :(
this is a problem with ALL linux
so no, I 'm not trying to convince anyone to use linux
it should work with hardy-backports? i have these in sources.list but i don't see a difference. hm
if you read the bug report you'll see the details
are we reading the same bug report? i see someone expressing a wish, but there is no solution. the backports version is also broken. but we cal also stop this discussion, i'll have to wait..
don't know, I've closed the bug reprot
i want what? i just never saw 486 in the output of uname recently
right, so if he wants to know which arch he is running, 486 is not the answer..
